page.title: Support & Resources
page.subtitle: You're not alone. Here are resources that can help.

crisis.title: Need Immediate Help?
crisis.content: If you're in crisis or having thoughts of self-harm, please reach out for help immediately:

international.name: International Crisis Lines
international.description: Find crisis support in your country

therapy.title: Finding Professional Help
therapy.content: While re-frame is a helpful tool, working with a therapist can provide personalized support:

inPerson.title: In-Person Therapy
inPerson.description: Face-to-face sessions with a licensed therapist in your area.

online.title: Online Therapy
online.description: Video sessions from the comfort of your home - great for those with social anxiety.

group.title: Support Groups
group.description: Connect with others who understand what you're going through.

findingHelp.title: How to Find a Therapist
tips: Ask your primary care doctor for referrals
Check with your insurance for covered providers
Look for therapists who specialize in social anxiety or AvPD
Consider therapists who offer CBT, DBT, or ACT

list.title: The Shyness and Social Anxiety Workbook
list.author: Martin Antony & Richard Swinson
list.description: Practical CBT exercises for social anxiety

list.title: Self-Compassion
list.author: Kristin Neff
list.description: Learning to be kind to yourself

list.name: r/AvPD
list.description: Supportive community for those with AvPD

list.name: 7 Cups
list.description: Free emotional support from trained listeners

tips.title: Daily Coping Strategies
list: Practice self-compassion - treat yourself like a good friend
Take small steps - progress is progress, no matter how small
Use grounding techniques when anxious (5-4-3-2-1 senses)
Maintain a routine that includes self-care
Celebrate small victories - they add up

reminder.title: Remember
reminder.content: Seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness. You deserve support and compassion on your journey.
